newsitem.title: USA: CBOT RICE ENDS NARROWLY MIXED IN QUIET TRADE.
newsitem.headline: CBOT RICE ENDS NARROWLY MIXED IN QUIET TRADE.

text.p: CBOT rice futures ended narrowly mixed on Friday and volume was said to be thin ahead of the weekend and Tuesday's USDA crop report, traders said.
Trade sources noted recent rains in Texas likely did more good than harm. The storm may have been strong enough to cause crop damage but the crop needed the moisture, they said.
"We're getting to the point in the season where heavy rains and high winds can be damaging but I haven't heard anything about (damage)," a trader said.
The market continued to watch weather patterns in Asia where El Nino threatened to hurt production.
Rice ended one cent per cwt higher to one cent lower with September unchanged at $9.70. Volume was estimated by CBOT at 300 lots, compared with Thursday's actual volume of 519.
